metadata.title: CVE-2014-4000 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Cacti before 1.0.0 allows remote authenticated users to conduct PHP objectinjection attacks and execute arbitrary PHP code via a crafted serializedobject, related to calling unserialize(stripslashes()).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4000` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cacti - 0.8.8b+dfsg-5ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cacti package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.8.8b+dfsg-5ubuntu0.2').
